div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1568 Kessab, c. 18 km. S of anc. Seleuceia Pieria, Seleucis, 1952 Burial: c. 110 B.C. ? (T) Contents: 388+ AR Athens: 40 New Style tetradr. (to Thomp- son 400) Demetrius I: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Demetrius II, 1st reign: 2 tetradr. (Se- leuceia ad Calycadum 1, unc. mint 1) Antiochus VII: 113 tetradr. (Tarsus 5, Mallus 1, Antiocheia 74, Damascus 21, Tyre 6, Seleuceia ad Tigrim 2, unc. mint 4) Demetrius II, 2nd reign: 29 tetradr. (Tar- sus 4, Antiocheia 20, Damascus 4, Ace 1) Alexander II: 66 tetradr. (Antiocheia 46, Damascus 12, unc. mint 8) Cleopatra Thea: 1 tetradr. (Ace) Cleopatra Thea and Antiochus VIII: 17 tetradr. (Antiocheia 4, Damascus 3, Ace 10) Antiochus VIII: 102 tetradr. (Antiocheia 8, Damascus 19, Sidon 5, Ace 70) Antiochus IX: 4 tetradr. (Antiocheia 2, Sidon 2 to 113/2 B.C.) Seleuceia Pieria: 12 tetradr. Phraates II: 1 tetradr. (Susa) Disposition: dispersed Thompson, Athens, pp. 475-7; NC T962, pp. 311-2 Lewis, NC 1962, p. 279 Seyrig, Tr√©sors du Levant (in press)
